panels.description: The total number of clients currently connected to DarkRift servers.
panels.title: Clients Connected

panels.description: The number of clients currently connected to each DarkRift server.
panels.title: Clients Connected Per Server

panels.description: The number of tasks in the dispatcher's queue. If this is continuously increasing then you will likely have rising memory usage and higher latencies on data; you should consider using more powerful hardware or reducing the number of tasks on the dispatcher e.g. by reducing the client's send rate.
panels.title: Dispatcher Queue Length

panels.description: The number of tasks in the dispatcher's queue. If this is continuously increasing then you will likely have rising memory usage and higher latencies on data; you should consider using more powerful hardware or reducing the number of tasks on the dispatcher e.g. by reducing the client's send rate.
panels.title: Dispatcher Queue Length

panels.description: The time tasks spend in the dispatcher's queue. If this is continuously increasing then you will likely have rising memory usage and higher latencies on data; you should consider using more powerful hardware or reducing the number of tasks on the dispatcher e.g. by reducing the client's send rate.
panels.title: Dispatcher Queue Time

panels.description: The time tasks spend in the dispatcher's queue. If this is continuously increasing then you will likely have rising memory usage and higher latencies on data; you should consider using more powerful hardware or reducing the number of tasks on the dispatcher e.g. by reducing the client's send rate.
panels.title: Dispatcher Queue Time

options.content:
These graphs show the current rates of messages and data going through your DarkRift servers.

The data rate graphs on the right are configured to use a Bichannel Listener and expect it to be called `DefaultNetworkListener`. If you're using a different network listener you'll need to change the graphs appropriately!

Note, metrics for these graphs are only recorded if `enablePerMessageMetrics` is `true` in your configuration.

panels.description: The number of bytes sent to the DarkRift server via UDP.
panels.title: UDP Bytes Sent

panels.description: The number of bytes received by the DarkRift server via UDP.
panels.title: UDP Bytes Received

panels.description: The number of messages sent from the DarkRift server.
panels.title: Messages Sent

panels.description: The number of messages received by the DarkRift server.
panels.title: Messages Received

panels.description: The number of bytes sent to the DarkRift server via TCP.
panels.title: TCP Bytes Sent

panels.description: The number of bytes received by the DarkRift server via TCP.
panels.title: TCP Bytes Received

panels.description: The number of bytes sent to the DarkRift server via UDP.
panels.title: Total UDP Bytes Sent

panels.description: The number of bytes received by the DarkRift server via UDP.
panels.title: Total UDP Bytes Received

panels.description: The number of messages sent from the DarkRift server.
panels.title: Total Messages Sent

panels.description: The number of messages received by the DarkRift server.
panels.title: Total Messages Received

panels.description: The number of bytes sent to the DarkRift server via TCP.
panels.title: Total TCP Bytes Sent

panels.description: The number of bytes received by the DarkRift server via TCP.
panels.title: Total TCP Bytes Received

options.content:
You can use these graphs to gauge performance of your business logic in the server. The faster you can make your event handlers, the more messages and clients a DarkRift server will be able to handle.

Event failures indicate an issue with your business logic that you should investigate. The logs for that server will contain the exception that occured and may help you diagnose the problem. It can be a good idea to set and alert on these graphs!

Note, timings for the Message Received event are only recorded if `enablePerMessageMetrics` is `true` in your configuration.

panels.description: The average time it took to execute the Client Connected event on a 1 minute rolling averge.
panels.title: Average Client Connected Event Execution Time

panels.description: The average time it took to execute the Message Received event on a 1 minute rolling averge.
panels.title: Average Message Recevied Event Execution Time

panels.description: The average time it took to execute the Client Disconnected event on a 1 minute rolling averge.
panels.title: Average Client Disconnected Event Execution Time

panels.description: The number of failures executing the Client Connected event
panels.title: Client Connected Event Failures

panels.description: The number of failures executing the Message Received event
panels.title: Message Received Event Failures

panels.description: The number of failures executing the Client Disconnected event
panels.title: Client Disconnected Event Failures

options.content:
These graphs and counters are designed to help you identify some more complex and subtler issues with your DarkRift servers.

In general, if something's not green then there's an opportunity for improvement but they often require deep knowledge of DarkRift to sort!

panels.description:
The number of finalizations of recyclable objects in the time period. This number being non-zero is a sign that you are not recycling objects properly in your logic.

Warnings will show in the logs of a server suffering from object recycling issues.
panels.title: Object Finalizations
